page.title: 05Brackley market day
page.content: The market place on a Friday is crowded with stalls and people. There is a lot of noise, not from the market, but from the traffic passing through the town. There are many cars, motorbikes and lorries. On some days it is quite interesting to see all the old cars going to Silverstone but it does make an extra amount of traffic. The market square is usually full of parked cars but at night it is a lorry park so the drivers can rest. The market place is in the middle of the main street so either side is lined with shops. At the end of the square is the Town Hall with its bell and on top is the weather vane. The square itself on market day is choc-a-block full of a bustling, shuffling crowd. After the market is over, the square is full of rubbish.
